trans-unit.source: This chronology defines the rules of the Japanese Imperial calendar system. This calendar system is primarily used in Japan. The Japanese Imperial calendar system is the same as the ISO calendar system apart from the era-based year numbering.
trans-unit.target: Esta cronología define las reglas del sistema de calendario imperial japonés.Este sistema de calendario se utiliza principalmente en Japón.El sistema de calendario imperial japonés es el mismo que el sistema de calendario ISO,aparte de la numeración del año basada en la época.

trans-unit.source: This chronology defines the rules of the Minguo calendar system. This calendar system is primarily used in the Republic of China, often known as Taiwan. Dates are aligned such that 0001-01-01 (Minguo) is 1912-01-01 (ISO).
trans-unit.target: Esta cronología define las reglas del sistema de calendario Minguo. Este sistema de calendario se utiliza principalmente en la República de China, a menudo conocida como Taiwán. Las fechas están alineadas de modo que 0001-01-01 (Minguo) es 1912-01-01 (ISO) .

trans-unit.source: This chronology defines the rules of the Thai Buddhist calendar system. This calendar system is primarily used in Thailand. Dates are aligned such that 2484-01-01 (Buddhist) is 1941-01-01 (ISO).
trans-unit.target: Esta cronología define las reglas del sistema de calendario budista tailandés. Este sistema de calendario se utiliza principalmente en Tailandia. Las fechas están alineadas de manera que 2484-01-01 (Buddhist) es 1941-01-01 (ISO) .

trans-unit.source: This class abstracts an NT security token and provides a mechanism to do same-process security impersonation.
This class acts as a factory for key managers based on a source of key material.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase actúa como una fábrica de gerentes clave basada en una fuente de material clave.

trans-unit.source: This class acts as a factory for key managers based on a source of key material. Each key manager manages a specific type of key material for use by secure sockets. The key material is based on a KeyStore and/or provider specific sources.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase actúa como una fábrica para los gerentes clave basada en una fuente de material clave.Cada gestor de claves gestiona un tipo específico de material de claves para su uso en enchufes seguros.El material clave se basa en un KeyStore y/o en fuentes específicas del proveedor.

trans-unit.source: This class acts as a factory for trust managers based on a source of trust material.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase actúa como una fábrica de gerentes de confianza basada en una fuente de material de confianza.

trans-unit.source: This class acts as a factory for trust managers based on a source of trust material. Each trust manager manages a specific type of trust material for use by secure sockets. The trust material is based on a KeyStore and/or provider specific sources.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase actúa como una fábrica de administradores de confianza basada en una fuente de material de confianza.Cada administrador de fideicomiso maneja un tipo específico de material de fideicomiso para ser usado en enchufes seguros.El material de confianza se basa en un KeyStore y/o en fuentes específicas del proveedor.

trans-unit.source: This class acts as a factory for trust managers based on a source of trust material. Each trust manager manages a specific type of trust material for use by secure sockets. The trust material is based on a KeyStore and/or provider-specific sources.
This class adds the ability to set JPEG quantization and Huffman tables when using the built-in JPEG reader plug-in.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase añade la capacidad de configurar la cuantificación JPEG y las tablas de Huffman cuando se utiliza el plug-in del lector JPEG incorporado.

trans-unit.source: This class adds the ability to set JPEG quantization and Huffman tables when using the built-in JPEG reader plug-in. An instance of this class will be returned from the getDefaultImageReadParam methods of the built-in JPEG ImageReader.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase agrega la capacidad de configurar la cuantificación de JPEG y las tablas de Huffman cuando se usa el complemento de lector de JPEG incorporado. Se devolverá una instancia de esta clase desde los métodos getDefaultImageReadParam del JPEG ImageReader integrado .

trans-unit.source: This class adds the ability to set JPEG quantization and Huffman tables when using the built-in JPEG writer plug-in, and to request that optimized Huffman tables be computed for an image.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase añade la capacidad de establecer la cuantificación JPEG y las tablas de Huffman cuando se utiliza el plug-in del escritor JPEG incorporado,y solicitar que se calculen las tablas optimizadas de Huffman para una imagen.

trans-unit.source: This class adds the ability to set JPEG quantization and Huffman tables when using the built-in JPEG writer plug-in, and to request that optimized Huffman tables be computed for an image. An instance of this class will be returned from the getDefaultImageWriteParam methods of the built-in JPEG ImageWriter.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase agrega la capacidad de configurar la cuantificación de JPEG y las tablas de Huffman cuando se usa el complemento de escritura de JPEG incorporado, y para solicitar que las tablas de Huffman optimizadas se calculen para una imagen. Se devolverá una instancia de esta clase desde los métodos getDefaultImageWriteParam del JPEG ImageWriter incorporado .

trans-unit.source: This class adheres strictly to the semantics, especially the failure semantics, of its ancestor classes java.io.FilterInputStream and java.io.InputStream. This class has exactly those methods specified in its ancestor classes, and overrides them all. Moreover, this class catches all exceptions that are not thrown by its ancestor classes. In particular, the skip method skips, and the available method counts only data that have been processed by the encapsulated Cipher.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase se adhiere estrictamente a la semántica, especialmente a la semántica de fallas, de sus clases ancestrales java.io.FilterInputStream y java.io.InputStream. Esta clase tiene exactamente esos métodos especificados en sus clases ancestrales y los reemplaza a todos. Además, esta clase detecta todas las excepciones que no son lanzadas por sus clases ancestrales. En particular, el método de skip omite y el método available solo cuenta los datos que han sido procesados ​​por el cifrado encapsulado.

trans-unit.source: This class adheres strictly to the semantics, especially the failure semantics, of its ancestor classes java.io.FilterInputStream and java.io.InputStream. This class has exactly those methods specified in its ancestor classes, and overrides them all. Moreover, this class catches all exceptions that are not thrown by its ancestor classes. In particular, the skip method skips, and the available method counts only data that have been processed by the encapsulated Cipher. This class may catch BadPaddingException and other exceptions thrown by failed integrity checks during decryption. These exceptions are not re-thrown, so the client may not be informed that integrity checks failed. Because of this behavior, this class may not be suitable for use with decryption in an authenticated mode of operation (e.g. GCM). Applications that require authenticated encryption can use the Cipher API directly as an alternative to using this class.

This class adheres strictly to the semantics, especially the failure semantics, of its ancestor classes java.io.OutputStream and java.io.FilterOutputStream. This class has exactly those methods specified in its ancestor classes, and overrides them all. Moreover, this class catches all exceptions that are not thrown by its ancestor classes.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase se adhiere estrictamente a la semántica,especialmente a la semántica del fracaso,de sus clases ancestrales java.io.OutputStream y java.io.FilterOutputStream.Esta clase tiene exactamente los métodos especificados en sus clases ancestrales,y los anula todos.Además,esta clase capta todas las excepciones que no son lanzadas por sus clases antecesoras.

trans-unit.source: This class adheres strictly to the semantics, especially the failure semantics, of its ancestor classes java.io.OutputStream and java.io.FilterOutputStream. This class has exactly those methods specified in its ancestor classes, and overrides them all. Moreover, this class catches all exceptions that are not thrown by its ancestor classes. In particular, this class catches BadPaddingException and other exceptions thrown by failed integrity checks during decryption. These exceptions are not re-thrown, so the client will not be informed that integrity checks failed. Because of this behavior, this class may not be suitable for use with decryption in an authenticated mode of operation (e.g. GCM) if the application requires explicit notification when authentication fails. Such an application can use the Cipher API directly as an alternative to using this class.

This class allows a SAX application to encapsulate information about an input source in a single object, which may include a public identifier, a system identifier, a byte stream (possibly with a specified encoding), and/or a character stream.

This class allows an application to create an input stream in which the bytes read are supplied by the contents of a string. Applications can also read bytes from a byte array by using a ByteArrayInputStream.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase permite que una aplicación cree un flujo de entrada en el que los bytes leídos son proporcionados por el contenido de una cadena. Las aplicaciones también pueden leer bytes de una matriz de bytes mediante ByteArrayInputStream .

trans-unit.source: This class allows for the specification of various parameters while writing a BMP format image file. By default, the data layout is bottom-up, such that the pixels are stored in bottom-up order, the first scanline being stored last.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase permite la especificación de varios parámetros mientras se escribe un archivo de imagen en formato BMP.Por defecto,la disposición de los datos es de abajo hacia arriba,de tal manera que los píxeles se almacenan en orden de abajo hacia arriba,la primera línea de escaneo se almacena en último lugar.

trans-unit.source: This class allows rules for identifying future transitions to be expressed. A rule might be written in many forms:
trans-unit.target: Esta clase permite que se expresen las reglas para identificar las transiciones futuras.Una regla puede ser escrita de muchas formas:

trans-unit.source: This class allows the Source to be the same as the Destination.

This class also defines factory methods that allow a ClassLoader to be specified when locating a provider. As with installed providers, the provider classes are identified by placing the provider configuration file in the resource directory META-INF/services.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también define métodos de fábrica que permiten especificar un ClassLoader al localizar un proveedor. Al igual que con los proveedores instalados, las clases de proveedores se identifican colocando el archivo de configuración del proveedor en el directorio de recursos META-INF/services .

trans-unit.source: This class also defines methods for maintaining a selector's cancelled-key set and for removing a key from its channel's key set, and declares the abstract register method that is invoked by a selectable channel's register method in order to perform the actual work of registering a channel.

This class also defines methods for maintaining a selector's cancelled-key set and for removing a key from its channel's key set, and declares the abstract register method that is invoked by a selectable channel's register method in order to perform the actual work of registering a channel.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también define métodos para mantener el conjunto de claves canceladas de un selector y para eliminar una clave del conjunto de claves de su canal, y declara el método de register abstracto que es invocado por el método de register un canal seleccionable para realizar el trabajo real de registrar un canal. .

trans-unit.source: This class also defines methods for replacing matched subsequences with new strings whose contents can, if desired, be computed from the match result. The appendReplacement and appendTail methods can be used in tandem in order to collect the result into an existing string buffer or string builder. Alternatively, the more convenient replaceAll method can be used to create a string in which every matching subsequence in the input sequence is replaced.

This class also defines methods for replacing matched subsequences with new strings whose contents can, if desired, be computed from the match result. The appendReplacement and appendTail methods can be used in tandem in order to collect the result into an existing string buffer, or the more convenient replaceAll method can be used to create a string in which every matching subsequence in the input sequence is replaced.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también define métodos para reemplazar subsecuencias coincidentes con nuevas cadenas cuyo contenido puede, si se desea, calcularse a partir del resultado de la coincidencia. Los métodos appendReplacement y appendTail se pueden usar en conjunto para recopilar el resultado en un búfer de cadena existente, o se puede usar el método replaceAll más conveniente para crear una cadena en la que se reemplazan todas las subsecuencias coincidentes en la secuencia de entrada.

trans-unit.source: This class also defines static methods for testing whether a particular charset is supported, for locating charset instances by name, and for constructing a map that contains every charset for which support is available in the current Java virtual machine. Support for new charsets can be added via the service-provider interface defined in the CharsetProvider class.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también define métodos estáticos para probar si un juego de caracteres en particular es compatible, para localizar instancias de juegos de caracteres por nombre y para construir un mapa que contenga cada juego de caracteres para el que haya soporte disponible en la máquina virtual Java actual. Se puede agregar soporte para nuevos conjuntos de caracteres a través de la interfaz del proveedor de servicios definida en la clase CharsetProvider .

trans-unit.source: This class also extends FileOwnerAttributeView so as to define methods to get and set the file owner.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también amplía FileOwnerAttributeView para definir métodos para obtener y establecer el propietario del archivo.

trans-unit.source: This class also provides additional commonly used bounded random generation methods.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también proporciona otros métodos de generación aleatoria delimitada de uso común.

trans-unit.source: This class also provides convenience methods to acquire and release multiple permits at a time. These methods are generally more efficient and effective than loops. However, they do not establish any preference order. For example, if thread A invokes s.acquire(3) and thread B invokes s.acquire(2), and two permits become available, then there is no guarantee that thread B will obtain them unless its acquire came first and Semaphore s is in fair mode.

This class also provides convenience methods to acquire and release multiple permits at a time. Beware of the increased risk of indefinite postponement when these methods are used without fairness set true.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también proporciona métodos prácticos para acquire y release varios permisos a la vez. Tenga cuidado con el mayor riesgo de aplazamiento indefinido cuando estos métodos se utilizan sin la equidad establecida como verdadera.

trans-unit.source: This class also provides efficient support for small sets of attributes and compresses them by sharing across uses and taking advantage of their immutable nature. Since many styles are replicated, the potential for sharing is significant, and copies can be extremely cheap. Larger sets reduce the possibility of sharing, and therefore revert automatically to a less space-efficient implementation.
This class also provides hooks that make it possible to supply custom descriptions and names for the MBeanInfo returned by the DynamicMBean interface.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también proporciona enlaces que permiten proporcionar descripciones y nombres personalizados para el MBeanInfo devuelto por la interfaz DynamicMBean.

trans-unit.source: This class also provides some concurrency support if the Document associated with the JTextComponent is a subclass of AbstractDocument. Access to the View (or View hierarchy) is serialized between any thread mutating the model and the Swing event thread (which is expected to render, do model/view coordinate translation, etc). Any access to the root view should first acquire a read-lock on the AbstractDocument and release that lock in a finally block.

This class also supports methods that conditionally provide conversions across the three modes. For example, method tryConvertToWriteLock(long) attempts to "upgrade" a mode, returning a valid write stamp if (1) already in writing mode (2) in reading mode and there are no other readers or (3) in optimistic mode and the lock is available. The forms of these methods are designed to help reduce some of the code bloat that otherwise occurs in retry-based designs.

This class also supports methods that conditionally provide conversions across the three modes. For example, method tryConvertToWriteLock(long) attempts to "upgrade" a mode, returning a valid write stamp if (1) already in writing mode (2) in reading mode and there are no other readers or (3) in optimistic read mode and the lock is available. The forms of these methods are designed to help reduce some of the code bloat that otherwise occurs in retry-based designs.

This class also supports methods that conditionally provide conversions across the three modes. The forms of these methods are designed to help reduce some of the code bloat that otherwise occurs in retry-based designs.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase también admite métodos que proporcionan conversiones condicionalmente en los tres modos. Por ejemplo, el método tryConvertToWriteLock(long) intenta "actualizar" un modo, devolviendo un sello de escritura válido si (1) ya está en modo de escritura (2) en modo de lectura y no hay otros lectores o (3) en modo optimista y el la cerradura está disponible. Las formas de estos métodos están diseñadas para ayudar a reducir parte del exceso de código que de otro modo se produce en los diseños basados ​​en reintentos.

trans-unit.source: This class always replaces malformed and unmappable character sequences with the charset's default replacement string. The CharsetEncoder class should be used when more control over the encoding process is required.
This class always replaces malformed surrogate elements and unmappable character sequences with the charset's default
trans-unit.target: Esta clase siempre reemplaza los elementos sustitutos malformados y las secuencias de caracteres no mapeables con el valor por defecto del juego de caracteres.

trans-unit.source: This class and its iterator implement all of the optional methods of the Collection and Iterator interfaces.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase y su iterador implementan todos los métodos opcionales de las interfaces Collection e Iterator .

If you need ordered traversal, consider using Arrays.sort(pq.toArray()). Also, method drainTo can be used to remove some or all elements in priority order and place them in another collection.

trans-unit.source: This class and its iterators implement all of the optional methods of the Set and Iterator interfaces. Like most other concurrent collection implementations, this class does not permit the use of null elements, because null arguments and return values cannot be reliably distinguished from the absence of elements.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase y sus iteradores implementan todos los métodos opcionales de las interfaces Set e Iterator . Como la mayoría de las otras implementaciones de colecciones concurrentes, esta clase no permite el uso de elementos null , porque null argumentos nulos y los valores de retorno no se pueden distinguir de manera confiable de la ausencia de elementos.

trans-unit.source: This class and its subclasses are responsible for mapping between raw tag numbers and TIFFTag objects, which contain additional information about each tag, such as the tag's name, legal data types, and mnemonic names for some or all of its data values.
This class and its views and iterators implement all of the optional methods of the Map and Iterator interfaces.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase y sus vistas e iteradores implementan todos los métodos opcionales de las interfaces Map e Iterator .

trans-unit.source: This class and its views and iterators implement all of the optional methods of the Map and Iterator interfaces. Like most other concurrent collections, this class does not permit the use of null keys or values because some null return values cannot be reliably distinguished from the absence of elements.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase y sus vistas e iteradores implementan todos los métodos opcionales de las interfaces Map e Iterator . Como la mayoría de otras colecciones concurrentes, esta clase no no permite el uso de null claves o valores debido a que algunos valores de retorno nulo no se pueden distinguir de forma fiable de la ausencia de elementos.

trans-unit.source: This class and the Observer interface have been deprecated.

This class and the Observer interface have been deprecated. The event model supported by Observer and Observable is quite limited, the order of notifications delivered by Observable is unspecified, and state changes are not in one-for-one correspondence with notifications. For a richer event model, consider using the java.beans package. For reliable and ordered messaging among threads, consider using one of the concurrent data structures in the java.util.concurrent package. For reactive streams style programming, see the Flow API.

This class associates, with each thread that uses it, a permit (in the sense of the Semaphore class). A call to park will return immediately if the permit is available, consuming it in the process; otherwise it may block. A call to unpark makes the permit available, if it was not already available. (Unlike with Semaphores though, permits do not accumulate. There is at most one.)
trans-unit.target: Esta clase asocia, con cada hilo que la usa, un permiso (en el sentido de la clase Semaphore ). Una llamada para park regresará inmediatamente si el permiso está disponible, consumiéndolo en el proceso; de lo contrario, puede bloquearse. Una llamada para unpark el estacionamiento hace que el permiso esté disponible, si aún no lo estaba. (Sin embargo, a diferencia de los semáforos, los permisos no se acumulan. Hay como máximo uno).

trans-unit.source: This class associates, with each thread that uses it, a permit (in the sense of the Semaphore class). A call to park will return immediately if the permit is available, consuming it in the process; otherwise it may block. A call to unpark makes the permit available, if it was not already available. (Unlike with Semaphores though, permits do not accumulate. There is at most one.) Reliable usage requires the use of volatile (or atomic) variables to control when to park or unpark. Orderings of calls to these methods are maintained with respect to volatile variable accesses, but not necessarily non-volatile variable accesses.

This class brings more flexibility to the notion of Management Interface in the use of Standard MBeans. Straightforward use of the patterns for Standard MBeans described in the JMX Specification means that there is a fixed relationship between the implementation class of an MBean and its management interface (i.e., if the implementation class is Thing, the management interface must be ThingMBean). This class makes it possible to keep the convenience of specifying the management interface with a Java interface, without requiring that there be any naming relationship between the implementation and interface classes.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase aporta más flexibilidad a la noción de Interfaz de Gestión en el uso de MBeans estándar.El uso sencillo de los patrones de MBeans estándar descritos en la Especificación JMX significa que existe una relación fija entre la clase de implementación de un MBean y su interfaz de gestión (es decir,si la clase de implementación es Thing,la interfaz de gestión debe ser ThingMBean).Esta clase permite mantener la conveniencia de especificar la interfaz de gestión con una interfaz Java,sin necesidad de que exista una relación de denominación entre las clases de implementación y de interfaz.

trans-unit.source: This class can be instantiated by using a string representation of the distinguished name, or by using the ASN.1 DER encoded byte representation of the distinguished name. The current specification for the string representation of a distinguished name is defined in RFC 2253: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (v3): UTF-8 String Representation of Distinguished Names. This class, however, accepts string formats from both RFC 2253 and RFC 1779: A String Representation of Distinguished Names, and also recognizes attribute type keywords whose OIDs (Object Identifiers) are defined in RFC 5280: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and CRL Profile.

The current specification for the string representation of a distinguished name is defined in RFC 2253: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (v3): UTF-8 String Representation of Distinguished Names. This class, however, accepts string formats from both RFC 2253 and RFC 1779: A String Representation of Distinguished Names, and also recognizes attribute type keywords whose OIDs (Object Identifiers) are defined in RFC 3280: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and CRL Profile.
trans-unit.target: Se puede crear una instancia de esta clase utilizando una representación de cadena del nombre distinguido, o utilizando la representación de bytes codificados en DER de ASN.1 del nombre distinguido. La especificación actual para la representación de cadena de un nombre distinguido se define en RFC 2253: Protocolo ligero de acceso a directorios (v3): Representación de cadena UTF-8 de nombres distinguidos . Sin embargo, esta clase acepta formatos de cadena de RFC 2253 y RFC 1779: una representación de cadena de nombres distinguidos , y también reconoce palabras clave de tipo de atributo cuyos OID (identificadores de objeto) se definen en RFC 3280: Certificado de infraestructura de clave pública X.509 de Internet y Perfil CRL .

trans-unit.source: This class cannot be instantiated. Only a single instance of this class can exist, and it may be obtained by using the getSplashScreen() static method. trans-unit.source: This class creates SSL sockets using the default SSLSocketFactory (see SSLSocketFactory.getDefault()) or the default SSLServerSocketFactory (see SSLServerSocketFactory.getDefault()) unless the constructor taking an SSLContext is used in which case the SSL sockets are created using the SSLSocketFactory returned by SSLContext.getSocketFactory() or the SSLServerSocketFactory returned by SSLContext.getServerSocketFactory(). When an SSLContext is not supplied all the instances of this class share the same keystore, and the same truststore (when client authentication is required by the server). This behavior can be modified by supplying an already initialized SSLContext instance.

This class creates SSL sockets using the default SSLSocketFactory (see SSLSocketFactory.getDefault()). All instances of this class are functionally equivalent. In particular, they all share the same truststore, and the same keystore when client authentication is required by the server. This behavior can be modified in subclasses by overriding the createSocket(String,int) method; in that case, equals and hashCode may also need to be overridden.

This class creates server sockets.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase crea sockets de servidores.

trans-unit.source: This class creates server sockets. It may be subclassed by other factories, which create particular types of server sockets. This provides a general framework for the addition of public socket-level functionality. It is the server side analogue of a socket factory, and similarly provides a way to capture a variety of policies related to the sockets being constructed.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase crea sockets de servidores.Puede ser subclasificada por otras fábricas,que crean tipos particulares de sockets de servidores.Esto proporciona un marco general para la adición de funcionalidad a nivel de sockets públicos.Es el análogo del lado del servidor de una fábrica de sockets,y de manera similar proporciona una forma de capturar una variedad de políticas relacionadas con los sockets que se están construyendo.

trans-unit.target: Esta clase crea enchufes.

trans-unit.source: This class defines a dismiss method that removes the editors ChangeListener from the JSpinner that it's part of. The setEditor method knows about DefaultEditor.dismiss, so if the developer replaces an editor that's derived from JSpinner.DefaultEditor its ChangeListener connection back to the JSpinner will be removed. However after that, it's up to the developer to manage their editor listeners. Similarly, if a subclass overrides createEditor, it's up to the subclasser to deal with their editor subsequently being replaced (with setEditor). We expect that in most cases, and in editor installed with setEditor or created by a createEditor override, will not be replaced anyway.
This class defines a content signing service. Implementations must be instantiable using a zero-argument constructor.
This class defines a lookup table object.

This class defines a lookup table object. The output of a lookup operation using an object of this class is interpreted as an unsigned byte quantity. The lookup table contains byte data arrays for one or more bands (or components) of an image, and it contains an offset which will be subtracted from the input values before indexing the arrays. This allows an array smaller than the native data size to be provided for a constrained input. If there is only one array in the lookup table, it will be applied to all bands.

This class defines a lookup table object. The output of a lookup operation using an object of this class is interpreted as an unsigned short quantity. The lookup table contains short data arrays for one or more bands (or components) of an image, and it contains an offset which will be subtracted from the input values before indexing the arrays. This allows an array smaller than the native data size to be provided for a constrained input. If there is only one array in the lookup table, it will be applied to all bands.

This class defines a nested AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject class that can be used as a Condition implementation by subclasses supporting exclusive mode for which method isHeldExclusively() reports whether synchronization is exclusively held with respect to the current thread, method release(int) invoked with the current getState() value fully releases this object, and acquire(int), given this saved state value, eventually restores this object to its previous acquired state. No AbstractQueuedSynchronizer method otherwise creates such a condition, so if this constraint cannot be met, do not use it. The behavior of AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject depends of course on the semantics of its synchronizer implementation.

This class defines a nested AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject class that can be used as a Condition implementation by subclasses supporting exclusive mode for which method isHeldExclusively() reports whether synchronization is exclusively held with respect to the current thread, method release(int) invoked with the current getState() value fully releases this object, and acquire(java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.Node, int, boolean, boolean, boolean, long), given this saved state value, eventually restores this object to its previous acquired state. No AbstractQueuedSynchronizer method otherwise creates such a condition, so if this constraint cannot be met, do not use it. The behavior of AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject depends of course on the semantics of its synchronizer implementation.

This class defines a nested AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject class that can be used as a Condition implementation by subclasses supporting exclusive mode for which method isHeldExclusively() reports whether synchronization is exclusively held with respect to the current thread, method release(int) invoked with the current getState() value fully releases this object, and acquire(int), given this saved state value, eventually restores this object to its previous acquired state. No AbstractQueuedSynchronizer method otherwise creates such a condition, so if this constraint cannot be met, do not use it. The behavior of AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject depends of course on the semantics of its synchronizer implementation.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase define un anidado AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject clase que puede ser utilizado como un Condition aplicación por las subclases de apoyo modo exclusivo para el cual método isHeldExclusively() informes si la sincronización se mantiene exclusivamente con respecto a la rosca actual, el método release(int) invoca con el actual getState() valor getState () libera completamente este objeto, y acquire(int) , dado este valor de estado guardado, eventualmente restaura este objeto a su estado adquirido anterior. Ningún método AbstractQueuedSynchronizer crea tal condición, por lo que si esta restricción no se puede cumplir, no la use. El comportamiento de AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject depende, por supuesto, de la semántica de su implementación de sincronizador.

trans-unit.source: This class defines all known operation-set bits, but precisely which bits are supported by a given channel depends upon the type of the channel. Each subclass of SelectableChannel defines a validOps() method which returns a set identifying just those operations that are supported by the channel. An attempt to set or test an operation-set bit that is not supported by a key's channel will result in an appropriate run-time exception.

Each subclass of SelectableChannel defines an validOps() method which returns a set identifying just those operations that are supported by the channel. An attempt to set or test an operation-set bit that is not supported by a key's channel will result in an appropriate run-time exception.

This class defines all known operation-set bits, but precisely which bits are supported by a given channel depends upon the type of the channel. Each subclass of SelectableChannel defines an validOps() method which returns a set identifying just those operations that are supported by the channel. An attempt to set or test an operation-set bit that is not supported by a key's channel will result in an appropriate run-time exception.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase define todos los bits de conjunto de operaciones conocidos, pero precisamente qué bits son compatibles con un canal determinado depende del tipo de canal. Cada subclase de SelectableChannel define un validOps() método que devuelve un conjunto de identificación de sólo aquellas operaciones que son soportados por el canal. Un intento de establecer o probar un bit de conjunto de operaciones que no es compatible con el canal de una clave resultará en una excepción de tiempo de ejecución apropiada.

trans-unit.source: This class defines methods for reading and writing values of all other primitive types, except boolean. Primitive values are translated to (or from) sequences of bytes according to the buffer's current byte order, which may be retrieved and modified via the order methods. Specific byte orders are represented by instances of the ByteOrder class. The initial order of a byte buffer is always BIG_ENDIAN.

This class defines methods for reading and writing values of all other primitive types, except boolean. Primitive values are translated to (or from) sequences of bytes according to the buffer's current byte order, which may be retrieved and modified via the order methods. Specific byte orders are represented by instances of the ByteOrder class. The initial order of a byte buffer is always BIG_ENDIAN.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase define métodos para leer y escribir valores de todos los demás tipos primitivos, excepto boolean os . Los valores primitivos se traducen a (o desde) secuencias de bytes de acuerdo con el orden de bytes actual del búfer, que se puede recuperar y modificar a través de los métodos de order . Los órdenes de bytes específicos están representados por instancias de la clase ByteOrder . El orden inicial de un búfer de bytes es siempre BIG_ENDIAN .

trans-unit.source: This class defines methods that handle the mechanics of channel registration, deregistration, and closing. It maintains the current blocking mode of this channel as well as its current set of selection keys. It performs all of the synchronization required to implement the SelectableChannel specification. Implementations of the abstract protected methods defined in this class need not synchronize against other threads that might be engaged in the same operations.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase define métodos que manejan la mecánica del registro, cancelación y cierre de canales. Mantiene el modo de bloqueo actual de este canal, así como su conjunto actual de teclas de selección. Realiza toda la sincronización necesaria para implementar la especificación SelectableChannel . Las implementaciones de los métodos protegidos abstractos definidos en esta clase no necesitan sincronizarse con otros subprocesos que podrían estar involucrados en las mismas operaciones.

trans-unit.source: This class defines several factory methods for constructing and combining memory access var handles.

This class defines several factory methods for constructing and combining memory access var handles. To obtain a memory access var handle, clients must start from one of the leaf methods (see varHandle(Class, ByteOrder), varHandle(Class, long, ByteOrder)). This determines the variable type (all primitive types but void and boolean are supported), as well as the alignment constraint and the byte order associated to a memory access var handle. The resulting memory access var handle can then be combined in various ways to emulate different addressing modes. The var handles created by this class feature a mandatory coordinate type (of type MemoryAddress), and zero or more long coordinate types, which can be used to emulate multi-dimensional array indexing.

trans-unit.source: This class defines the methods supportsParameter() and newInstance() which are used by the Java security framework when it searches for suitable services and instantiates them. The valid arguments to those methods depend on the type of service. For the service types defined within Java SE, see the Java Cryptography Architecture (JCA) Reference Guide for the valid values. Note that components outside of Java SE can define additional types of services and their behavior.

This class defines the methods supportsParameter() and newInstance() which are used by the Java security framework when it searches for suitable services and instantiates them. The valid arguments to those methods depend on the type of service. For the service types defined within Java SE, see the Java Cryptography Architecture (JCA) Reference Guide for the valid values. Note that components outside of Java SE can define additional types of services and their behavior.

This class defines the methods supportsParameter() and newInstance() which are used by the Java security framework when it searches for suitable services and instantiates them. The valid arguments to those methods depend on the type of service. For the service types defined within Java SE, see the Java Cryptography Architecture API Specification & Reference for the valid values. Note that components outside of Java SE can define additional types of services and their behavior.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase define los métodos supportsParameter() y newInstance() que son usados ​​por el marco de seguridad de Java cuando busca servicios adecuados y los instancia. Los argumentos válidos para esos métodos dependen del tipo de servicio. Para los tipos de servicio definidos en Java SE, consulte la Especificación y referencia de la API de arquitectura de criptografía de Java para conocer los valores válidos. Tenga en cuenta que los componentes fuera de Java SE pueden definir tipos adicionales de servicios y su comportamiento.

trans-unit.source: This class defines the valid eras for the Japanese chronology. Japan introduced the Gregorian calendar starting with Meiji 6. Only Meiji and later eras are supported; dates before Meiji 6, January 1 are not supported.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase define las eras válidas para la cronología japonesa.Japón introdujo el calendario gregoriano que comienza con Meiji 6.Sólo se admiten las eras Meiji y posteriores;no se admiten las fechas anteriores a Meiji 6,1 de enero.

trans-unit.source: This class defines useful layout constants.

This class defines useful layout constants. Some of the constants defined in this class are explicit in both size and byte order (see BITS_64_BE), and can therefore be used to explicitly and unambiguously specify the contents of a memory segment. Other constants make implicit byte order assumptions (see JAVA_INT); as such, these constants make it easy to work with other serialization-centric APIs, such as ByteBuffer.

This class deflates sequences of bytes into ZLIB compressed data format. The input byte sequence is provided in either byte array or byte buffer, via one of the setInput() methods. The output byte sequence is written to the output byte array or byte buffer passed to the deflate() methods.
This class depends upon EventQueueMonitor, which provides the base level support for capturing the top-level containers as they are created.

trans-unit.source: This class does not store or represent a date or time-zone. Instead, it is a description of the local time as seen on a wall clock. It cannot represent an instant on the time-line without additional information such as an offset or time-zone.

trans-unit.source: This class enables one to store an entry in the defaults table that isn't constructed until the first time it's looked up with one of the getXXX(key) methods.

This class enables one to store an entry in the defaults table that isn't constructed until the first time it's looked up with one of the getXXX(key) methods. Lazy values are useful for defaults that are expensive to construct or are seldom retrieved. The first time a LazyValue is retrieved its "real value" is computed by calling LazyValue.createValue() and the real value is used to replace the LazyValue in the UIDefaults table. Subsequent lookups for the same key return the real value. Here's an example of a LazyValue that constructs a Border:

This class encapsulates a Kerberos principal.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates a Kerberos ticket and associated information as viewed from the client's point of view. It captures all information that the Key Distribution Center (KDC) sends to the client in the reply message KDC-REP defined in the Kerberos Protocol Specification (RFC 4120).
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula un ticket de Kerberos y la información asociada tal como se ve desde el punto de vista del cliente. Captura toda la información que el Centro de distribución de claves (KDC) envía al cliente en el mensaje de respuesta KDC-REP definido en la Especificación del protocolo Kerberos ( RFC 4120 ).

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates a Kerberos ticket and associated information as viewed from the client's point of view. It captures all information that the Key Distribution Center (KDC) sends to the client in the reply message KDC-REP defined in the Kerberos Protocol Specification (RFC 4120).

This class encapsulates a collection of states of the Accessible object and is obtained by calling the getAccessibleStateSet method on an AccessibleContext. Since an object might have multiple states (e.g. it might be both "Checked" and "Focused"), this class is needed to encapsulate a collection of these states. Methods in the class provide for retrieving the individual AccessibleStates on the state set.
This class encapsulates a keytab file.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula un archivo de teclado.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates a long term secret key for a Kerberos principal.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula una llave secreta a largo plazo para un director de Kerberos.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates a particular state of the Accessible object. Accessible states include things like "Armed", "Busy", "Checked", "Focused", etc. These roles are identified by the constants in this class such as AccessibleState.ARMED, AccessibleState.BUSY, AccessibleState.CHECKED, and AccessibleState.FOCUSED. The sum of all the states of an Accessible object is called the AccessibleStateSet, and can be obtained by calling the getAccessibleStateSet method on an AccessibleContext.
This class encapsulates a single tab stop (basically as tab stops are thought of by RTF).

This class encapsulates a single tab stop (basically as tab stops are thought of by RTF). A tab stop is at a specified distance from the left margin, aligns text in a specified way, and has a specified leader. TabStops are immutable, and usually contained in TabSets.
This class encapsulates all relevant details of a clipboard or drag and drop transfer, and also allows for customizing aspects of the drag and drop experience.
This class encapsulates an EncryptionKey used in Kerberos.
This class encapsulates factors that determine scope of search and what gets returned as a result of the search.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula los factores que determinan el alcance de la búsqueda y lo que se devuelve como resultado de la misma.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates information about a code signer.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula información sobre un firmante de código.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates information about a code signer. It is immutable.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula información sobre un firmante de código.Es inmutable.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates information about a signed timestamp.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula información sobre una marca de tiempo firmada.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates information about a signed timestamp. It is immutable. It includes the timestamp's date and time as well as information about the Timestamping Authority (TSA) which generated and signed the timestamp.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase encapsula información sobre una marca de tiempo firmada.Es inmutable.Incluye la fecha y la hora de la marca de tiempo,así como información sobre la Autoridad de Marcas de Tiempo (TSA)que generó y firmó la marca de tiempo.

trans-unit.source: This class encapsulates the Accessible object's role in the user interface and is obtained by calling the getAccessibleRole method on an AccessibleContext. Accessible roles include "Check box", "Menu Item", "Panel", etc. These roles are identified by the constants in this class such as AccessibleRole.CHECK_BOX, AccessibleRole.MENU_ITEM, and AccessibleRole.PANEL. The constants in this class present a strongly typed enumeration of common object roles. A public constructor for this class has been purposely omitted and applications should use one of the constants from this class. Although this class pre-defines a large list of standard roles, it is extensible so additional programmer-defined roles can be added in the future without needing to modify the base class.
This class encapsulates the concept of caller-provided channel binding information.

This class encapsulates the concept of caller-provided channel binding information. Channel bindings are used to strengthen the quality with which peer entity authentication is provided during context establishment. They enable the GSS-API callers to bind the establishment of the security context to relevant characteristics like addresses or to application specific data.

This class encapsulates the logic of Namespace processing: it tracks the declarations currently in force for each context and automatically processes qualified XML names into their Namespace parts; it can also be used in reverse for generating XML qnames from Namespaces.

This class encapsulates the low-level machinery required to implement the asynchronous closing and interruption of channels. A concrete channel class must invoke the begin and end methods before and after, respectively, invoking an I/O operation that might block indefinitely. In order to ensure that the end method is always invoked, these methods should be used within a try ... finally block:

A concrete channel class must invoke the begin and end methods before and after, respectively, invoking an I/O operation that might block indefinitely. In order to ensure that the end method is always invoked, these methods should be used within a try ... finally block:

A concrete selector class must invoke the begin and end methods before and after, respectively, invoking an I/O operation that might block indefinitely. In order to ensure that the end method is always invoked, these methods should be used within a try ... finally block:

A concrete selector class must invoke the begin and end methods before and after, respectively, invoking an I/O operation that might block indefinitely. In order to ensure that the end method is always invoked, these methods should be used within a try ... finally block:

trans-unit.source: This class exists to wrap one or more data arrays.

This class exists to wrap one or more data arrays. Each data array in the DataBuffer is referred to as a bank. Accessor methods for getting and setting elements of the DataBuffer's banks exist with and without a bank specifier. The methods without a bank specifier use the default 0th bank. The DataBuffer can optionally take an offset per bank, so that data in an existing array can be used even if the interesting data doesn't start at array location zero. Getting or setting the 0th element of a bank, uses the (0+offset)th element of the array. The size field specifies how much of the data array is available for use. Size + offset for a given bank should never be greater than the length of the associated data array. The data type of a data buffer indicates the type of the data array(s) and may also indicate additional semantics, e.g. storing unsigned 8-bit data in elements of a byte array. The data type may be TYPE_UNDEFINED or one of the types defined below. Other types may be added in the future. Generally, an object of class DataBuffer will be cast down to one of its data type specific subclasses to access data type specific methods for improved performance. Currently, the Java 2D(tm) API image classes use TYPE_BYTE, TYPE_USHORT, TYPE_INT, TYPE_SHORT, TYPE_FLOAT, and TYPE_DOUBLE DataBuffers to store image data.
This class expresses a Language Range defined in RFC 4647 Matching of Language Tags.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase expresa un rango de idioma definido en RFC 4647 Matching of Language Tags .

trans-unit.source: This class expresses a Language Range defined in RFC 4647 Matching of Language Tags. A language range is an identifier which is used to select language tag(s) meeting specific requirements by using the mechanisms described in Locale Matching. A list which represents a user's preferences and consists of language ranges is called a Language Priority List.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase expresa un rango de idioma definido en RFC 4647 Matching of Language Tags . Un rango de idioma es un identificador que se usa para seleccionar etiquetas de idioma que cumplen con requisitos específicos mediante el uso de los mecanismos descritos en Coincidencia de idioma . Una lista que representa las preferencias de un usuario y consta de rangos de idiomas se denomina Lista de prioridad de idioma .

trans-unit.source: This class expresses a Language Range defined in RFC 4647 Matching of Language Tags.

This class expresses a Language Range defined in RFC 4647 Matching of Language Tags. A language range is an identifier which is used to select language tag(s) meeting specific requirements by using the mechanisms described in Locale Matching. A list which represents a user's preferences and consists of language ranges is called a Language Priority List.
This class extends Number, but does not define methods such as equals, hashCode and compareTo because instances are expected to be mutated, and so are not useful as collection keys.
This class extends Number, but does not define methods such as equals, hashCode and compareTo because instances are expected to be mutated, and so are not useful as collection keys.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase amplía Number , pero no define métodos como equals , hashCode y compareTo porque se espera que las instancias estén mutadas y, por lo tanto, no son útiles como claves de colección.

trans-unit.source: This class extends PrintService and represents a print service that prints data in different formats to a client-provided output stream.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase extiende PrintService y representa un servicio de impresión que imprime datos en diferentes formatos en un flujo de salida proporcionado por el cliente.

trans-unit.source: This class extends PrintService and represents a print service that prints data in different formats to a client-provided output stream. This is principally intended for services where the output format is a document type suitable for viewing or archiving. The output format must be declared as a mime type. This is equivalent to an output document flavor where the representation class is always "java.io.OutputStream" An instance of the StreamPrintService class is obtained from a StreamPrintServiceFactory instance.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase extiende PrintService y representa un servicio de impresión que imprime datos en diferentes formatos en un flujo de salida proporcionado por el cliente. Está destinado principalmente a servicios en los que el formato de salida es un tipo de documento adecuado para su visualización o archivo. El formato de salida debe declararse como un tipo mime. Esto es equivalente a un tipo de documento de salida donde la clase de representación es siempre "java.io.OutputStream". Una instancia de la clase StreamPrintService se obtiene de una instancia StreamPrintServiceFactory .

This class extends DataBuffer and stores data internally as bytes. Values stored in the byte array(s) of this DataBuffer are treated as unsigned values.
This class extends DataBuffer and stores data internally as integers.
This class extends DataBuffer and stores data internally as shorts.
This class extends DataBuffer and stores data internally as shorts. Values stored in the short array(s) of this DataBuffer are treated as unsigned values.

This class extends ServerSockets and provides secure server sockets using protocols such as the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) or Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols.

trans-unit.source: This class extends ThreadLocal to provide inheritance of values from parent thread to child thread: when a child thread is created, the child receives initial values for all inheritable thread-local variables for which the parent has values.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase extiende ThreadLocal para proporcionar herencia de valores desde el hilo principal al hilo hijo: cuando se crea un hilo hijo, el hijo recibe valores iniciales para todas las variables locales de hilo heredables para las cuales el padre tiene valores.

trans-unit.source: This class extends ThreadLocal to provide inheritance of values from parent thread to child thread: when a child thread is created, the child receives initial values for all inheritable thread-local variables for which the parent has values. Normally the child's values will be identical to the parent's; however, the child's value can be made an arbitrary function of the parent's by overriding the childValue method in this class.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase extiende ThreadLocal para proporcionar herencia de valores desde el hilo principal al hilo hijo: cuando se crea un hilo hijo, el hijo recibe valores iniciales para todas las variables locales de hilo heredables para las cuales el padre tiene valores. Normalmente, los valores del niño serán idénticos a los del padre; sin embargo, el valor del hijo se puede convertir en una función arbitraria del padre anulando el método childValue en esta clase.

trans-unit.source: This class extends javax.management.MBeanFeatureInfo and thus provides name and description fields. The name field should be the fully qualified Java class name of the notification objects described by this class.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase extiende javax.management.MBeanFeatureInfo y, por lo tanto, proporciona campos de name y description . El campo de name debe ser el nombre de clase Java completo de los objetos de notificación descritos por esta clase.

trans-unit.source: This class extends ClassLoader with additional support for defining classes with an associated code source and permissions which are retrieved by the system policy by default.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase amplía el ClassLoader con soporte adicional para definir clases con un código fuente asociado y permisos que son recuperados por la política del sistema por defecto.

trans-unit.source: This class extends Raster to provide pixel writing capabilities.
This class extends Raster to provide pixel writing capabilities. Refer to the class comment for Raster for descriptions of how a Raster stores pixels.
This class extends TransformerFactory to provide SAX-specific factory methods.
This class extends TransformerFactory to provide SAX-specific factory methods. It provides two types of ContentHandlers, one for creating Transformers, the other for creating Templates objects.
This class extends the SAX2 base handler class to support the SAX2 LexicalHandler, DeclHandler, and EntityResolver2 extensions.

This class extends the SAX2 base handler class to support the SAX2 LexicalHandler, DeclHandler, and EntityResolver2 extensions. Except for overriding the original SAX1 resolveEntity() method the added handler methods just return. Subclassers may override everything on a method-by-method basis.

This class extends the basic ImageFilter Class to scale an existing image and provide a source for a new image containing the resampled image. The pixels in the source image are blended to produce pixels for an image of the specified size. The blending process is analogous to scaling up the source image to a multiple of the destination size using pixel replication and then scaling it back down to the destination size by simply averaging all the pixels in the supersized image that fall within a given pixel of the destination image. If the data from the source is not delivered in TopDownLeftRight order then the filter will back off to a simple pixel replication behavior and utilize the requestTopDownLeftRightResend() method to refilter the pixels in a better way at the end.
This class extends the concept of a codebase to encapsulate not only the location (URL) but also the certificate chains that were used to verify signed code originating from that location.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase amplía el concepto de una base de código para encapsular no sólo la ubicación (URL)sino también las cadenas de certificados que se utilizaron para verificar el código firmado originado en esa ubicación.

trans-unit.source: This class extends the standard equations defined by Porter and Duff to include one additional factor. An instance of the AlphaComposite class can contain an alpha value that is used to modify the opacity or coverage of every source pixel before it is used in the blending equations.

This class handles conversion from the local time-line of LocalDateTime to the instant time-line of Instant. The difference between the two time-lines is the offset from UTC/Greenwich, represented by a ZoneOffset.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase maneja la conversión de la línea de tiempo local de LocalDateTime a la línea de tiempo Instant de Instant . La diferencia entre las dos líneas de tiempo es el desplazamiento de UTC / Greenwich, representado por un ZoneOffset .

trans-unit.source: This class handles the renderable aspects of an operation with help from its associated instance of a ContextualRenderedImageFactory.

This class has been deprecated.

trans-unit.source: This class holds a small number of attributes in an array.

This class holds a small number of attributes in an array. The storage format is key, value, key, value, etc. The size of the set is the length of the array divided by two. By default, this is the class that will be used to store attributes when held in the compact sharable form.
This class ignores PropertyChangeEvents whose source is not the JFormattedTextField, so subclasses may safely make thisDefaultEditor a PropertyChangeListener on other objects.

This class implementation retrieves and makes available Unix UID/GID/groups information for the current user.

This class implements TemporalAccessor rather than Temporal. This is because it is not possible to define whether February 29th is valid or not without external information, preventing the implementation of plus/minus. Related to this, MonthDay only provides access to query and set the fields MONTH_OF_YEAR and DAY_OF_MONTH.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa TemporalAccessor en lugar de Temporal . Esto se debe a que no es posible definir si el 29 de febrero es válido o no sin información externa, lo que impide la implementación de más / menos. En relación con esto, MonthDay solo proporciona acceso para consultar y configurar los campos MONTH_OF_YEAR y DAY_OF_MONTH .

This class implements a convolution from the source to the destination.

This class implements a convolution from the source to the destination. Convolution using a convolution kernel is a spatial operation that computes the output pixel from an input pixel by multiplying the kernel with the surround of the input pixel. This allows the output pixel to be affected by the immediate neighborhood in a way that can be mathematically specified with a kernel.
This class implements a decoder for decoding byte data using the Base64 encoding scheme as specified in RFC 4648 and RFC 2045.

This class implements a filter for the set of interface methods that are used to deliver data from an ImageProducer to an ImageConsumer.

This class implements a filter for the set of interface methods that are used to deliver data from an ImageProducer to an ImageConsumer. It is meant to be used in conjunction with a FilteredImageSource object to produce filtered versions of existing images. It is a base class that provides the calls needed to implement a "Null filter" which has no effect on the data being passed through. Filters should subclass this class and override the methods which deal with the data that needs to be filtered and modify it as necessary.

trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa una tabla hash, que asigna claves a valores. Cualquier objeto no null se puede utilizar como clave o como valor.

trans-unit.source: This class implements a locking mechanism for the document. It allows multiple readers or one writer, and writers must wait until all observers of the document have been notified of a previous change before beginning another mutation to the document. The read lock is acquired and released using the render method. A write lock is acquired by the methods that mutate the document, and are held for the duration of the method call. Notification is done on the thread that produced the mutation, and the thread has full read access to the document for the duration of the notification, but other readers are kept out until the notification has finished. The notification is a beans event notification which does not allow any further mutations until all listeners have been notified.
This class implements a lookup operation from the source to the destination.
This class implements a lookup operation from the source to the destination. The LookupTable object may contain a single array or multiple arrays, subject to the restrictions below.
This class implements a simple HTTP server.

This class implements a simple HTTP server. A HttpServer is bound to an IP address and port number and listens for incoming TCP connections from clients on this address. The sub-class HttpsServer implements a server which handles HTTPS requests.

trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un filtro de flujo para leer datos comprimidos en el formato de archivo GZIP.

trans-unit.source: This class implements a vector of bits that grows as needed.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un vector de bits que crece según se necesite.

trans-unit.source: This class implements a vector of bits that grows as needed. Each component of the bit set has a boolean value. The bits of a BitSet are indexed by nonnegative integers. Individual indexed bits can be examined, set, or cleared. One BitSet may be used to modify the contents of another BitSet through logical AND, logical inclusive OR, and logical exclusive OR operations.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un vector de bits que crece según sea necesario. Cada componente del conjunto de bits tiene un valor boolean o . Los bits de un BitSet están indexados por enteros no negativos. Los bits indexados individuales se pueden examinar, establecer o borrar. Un BitSet se puede utilizar para modificar el contenido de otro BitSet mediante operaciones lógicas AND, lógicas OR inclusivas y lógicas OR exclusivas.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an encoder for encoding byte data using the Base64 encoding scheme as specified in RFC 4648 and RFC 2045.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un codificador para codificar los datos de los bytes utilizando el esquema de codificación Base64,tal como se especifica en RFC 4648 y RFC 2045.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an input stream filter for reading files in the ZIP file format.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un filtro de flujo de entrada para leer archivos en el formato de archivo ZIP.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an input stream filter for reading files in the ZIP file format. Includes support for both compressed and uncompressed entries.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un filtro de flujo de entrada para leer archivos en el formato de archivo ZIP.Incluye soporte para entradas comprimidas y no comprimidas.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an output stream filter for compressing data in the "deflate" compression format.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un filtro de flujo de salida para comprimir los datos en el formato de compresión "deflate".

trans-unit.source: This class implements an output stream filter for compressing data in the "deflate" compression format. It is also used as the basis for other types of compression filters, such as GZIPOutputStream.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un filtro de flujo de salida para comprimir los datos en el formato de compresión "deflate".También se utiliza como base para otros tipos de filtros de compresión,como el GZIPOutputStream.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an output stream filter for writing files in the ZIP file format.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un filtro de flujo de salida para escribir archivos en el formato de archivo ZIP.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an output stream filter for writing files in the ZIP file format. Includes support for both compressed and uncompressed entries.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un filtro de flujo de salida para escribir archivos en el formato de archivo ZIP.Incluye soporte para entradas comprimidas y no comprimidas.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an output stream in which the data is written into a byte array.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un flujo de salida en el que los datos se escriben en una matriz de bytes.

trans-unit.source: This class implements an output stream in which the data is written into a byte array. The buffer automatically grows as data is written to it. The data can be retrieved using toByteArray() and toString().
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa un flujo de salida en el que los datos se escriben en una matriz de bytes. El búfer crece automáticamente a medida que se escriben datos en él. Los datos se pueden recuperar usando toByteArray() y toString() .

trans-unit.source: This class implements client sockets (also called just "sockets").
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa los sockets de los clientes (también llamados simplemente "sockets").

trans-unit.source: This class implements client sockets (also called just "sockets"). A socket is an endpoint for communication between two machines.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa los sockets de los clientes (también llamados simplemente "sockets").Un socket es un punto final para la comunicación entre dos máquinas.

trans-unit.source: This class implements of the NotificationFilter interface for the attribute change notification.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa la interfaz NotificationFilter para la attribute change notification .

trans-unit.source: This class implements of the NotificationFilter interface for the attribute change notification. The filtering is performed on the name of the observed attribute.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa la interfaz NotificationFilter para la attribute change notification . El filtrado se realiza sobre el nombre del atributo observado.

trans-unit.source: This class implements server sockets.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa los sockets de los servidores.

trans-unit.source: This class implements server sockets. A server socket waits for requests to come in over the network. It performs some operation based on that request, and then possibly returns a result to the requester.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa los sockets de los servidores.Un socket de servidor espera a que las peticiones lleguen a través de la red.Realiza alguna operación basada en esa solicitud,y luego posiblemente devuelve un resultado al solicitante.

trans-unit.source: This class implements the CharSequence interface so that character buffers may be used wherever character sequences are accepted, for example in the regular-expression package java.util.regex.

This class implements the CharSequence interface so that character buffers may be used wherever character sequences are accepted, for example in the regular-expression package java.util.regex. The methods defined by CharSequence operate relative to the current position of the buffer when they are invoked.
This class implements the CharSequence interface so that character buffers may be used wherever character sequences are accepted, for example in the regular-expression package java.util.regex.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa la interfaz CharSequence para que los búferes de caracteres se puedan utilizar siempre que se acepten secuencias de caracteres, por ejemplo, en el paquete de expresiones regulares java.util.regex .

trans-unit.source: This class implements the EncryptedPrivateKeyInfo type as defined in PKCS #8.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa el tipo EncryptedPrivateKeyInfo como se define en PKCS # 8.

trans-unit.source: This class implements the Map interface with a hash table, using reference-equality in place of object-equality when comparing keys (and values).
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa la interfaz Map con una tabla hash, utilizando la igualdad de referencias en lugar de la igualdad de objetos al comparar claves (y valores).

trans-unit.source: This class implements the Map interface with a hash table, using reference-equality in place of object-equality when comparing keys (and values). In other words, in an IdentityHashMap, two keys k1 and k2 are considered equal if and only if (k1==k2). (In normal Map implementations (like HashMap) two keys k1 and k2 are considered equal if and only if (k1==null ? k2==null : k1.equals(k2)).)
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa la interfaz Map con una tabla hash, utilizando la igualdad de referencias en lugar de la igualdad de objetos al comparar claves (y valores). En otras palabras, en un IdentityHashMap , dos claves k1 y k2 se consideran iguales si y solo si (k1==k2) . (En implementaciones normales de Map (como HashMap ), dos claves k1 y k2 se consideran iguales si y solo si (k1==null ? k2==null : k1.equals(k2)) .)

trans-unit.source: This class implements the Principal interface and represents a Unix user.
This class implements the Principal interface and represents a Windows NT user.
This class implements the Principal interface and represents a user's Unix group identification number (GID).
This class implements the Principal interface and represents a user's Unix identification number (UID).
This class implements the Principal interface and represents information about a Windows NT user, group or realm.
This class implements the Principal interface and represents the name of the Windows NT domain into which the user authenticated.

This class implements the Principal interface and represents the name of the Windows NT domain into which the user authenticated. This will be a domain name if the user logged into a Windows NT domain, a workgroup name if the user logged into a workgroup, or a machine name if the user logged into a standalone configuration.
This class implements the Set interface, backed by a hash table (actually a HashMap instance).
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa la interfaz Set , respaldada por una tabla hash (en realidad, una instancia de HashMap ).

trans-unit.source: This class implements the Set interface, backed by a hash table (actually a HashMap instance). It makes no guarantees as to the iteration order of the set; in particular, it does not guarantee that the order will remain constant over time. This class permits the null element.
trans-unit.target: Esta clase implementa la interfaz Set , respaldada por una tabla hash (en realidad, una instancia de HashMap ). No ofrece ninguna garantía en cuanto al orden de iteración del conjunto; en particular, no garantiza que el pedido se mantenga constante en el tiempo. Esta clase permite el elemento null .
